title: White Shadows in the South Seas

sources.title: White Shadows in the South Seas
White Shadows in the South Seas (1928)
sources.description: I've been researching newly public domain films from 1929 and earlier, so I'm uploading the best possible copies that I can find. Clyde De Vinna won an Academy Award for cinematography in this strange romance tragedy that takes place on a series of Polynesian islands. While the film was a huge box office success, critics were less pleased. In addition, some audiences were annoyed that the film advertised itself as a sound picture, when there is very little dialogue in the film.Â

metadata.Plot: Matthew Lloyd has drifted away from a respectable career as a physician, and lives a mediocre existence in a Polynesian island. There, pearl-trader Sebastian and his associates recklessly exploit the natives working for them as divers. After witnessing the appalling consequences of "civilization" on the local population, Matthew vehemently condemns Sebastian's greed and ruthlessness. Sebastian, however, will not shy away from any means to crush opposition to his activities.
metadata.Director: W.S. Van Dyke, Robert J. Flaherty
metadata.Writer: Frederick O'Brien, Ray Doyle, Jack Cunningham
metadata.Actors: Monte Blue, Raquel Torres, Robert Anderson
